flights.Key_Evidence: • Immediately after landing the controller tells SKW4744 it will be held away from the gate, indicating the gate is not yet available even though the flight just landed. | • Transcript shows no late-departure or mechanical problem for the E3 occupant; confirms gate delay is not caused by a late departure or mechanical but by SKW4744 arriving early. | • After more than 30 minutes of holding, SKW4744 finally receives taxi clearance to Gate E3, showing the delay ended once the gate became free (previous flight pushed on-time at 08:20).

Evidence_Details.message: Skywest 4744, cross runway 28L, ground 0.8, sounds like they're going to hold you in the G ramp.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Immediately after landing the controller tells SKW4744 it will be held away from the gate, indicating the gate is not yet available even though the flight just landed.

Evidence_Details.message: No references to SKW5433 running late; Delta 640 maintenance issue unrelated to Gate E3.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Transcript shows no late-departure or mechanical problem for the E3 occupant; confirms gate delay is not caused by a late departure or mechanical but by SKW4744 arriving early.

Evidence_Details.message: Ground, good morning, Skywest 4744, spot 10 for Echo 3.
Evidence_Details.relevance: After more than 30 minutes of holding, SKW4744 finally receives taxi clearance to Gate E3, showing the delay ended once the gate became free (previous flight pushed on-time at 08:20).

flights.Key_Evidence: • Controller tells SKW5617 it must hold on the ramp, indicating its gate is not yet available despite landing. | • Previous flight (SKW5709) is still occupying the F-pier area shortly after SKW5617 landed, showing the gate was legitimately still in use. | • Push-back for the previous aircraft occurs nearly 25 min after SKW5617 landed; SKW5709 was NOT late (data show it pushed 6 min early), so the overlap exists only because SKW5617 arrived 36 min ahead of schedule.

Evidence_Details.message: 5617, they're going to hold you in the GRAMP as well, cross runway 28L, ground point X-ray.

Evidence_Details.message: Skywest 5709, hold position just a moment.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Previous flight (SKW5709) is still occupying the F-pier area shortly after SKW5617 landed, showing the gate was legitimately still in use.

Evidence_Details.message: Skywest 5709, push approved, expect to beam Foxtrot 7.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Push-back for the previous aircraft occurs nearly 25 min after SKW5617 landed; SKW5709 was NOT late (data show it pushed 6 min early), so the overlap exists only because SKW5617 arrived 36 min ahead of schedule.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold, triggering possible gate-conflict scenario. | • Gate F7 was legitimately occupied until 08:26, so the arriving aircraft had no gate to park when it reached the ramp; no late-departure condition exists. | • Ramp instructs SKW5313 to hold in the alley, confirming it is waiting for a gate to open because it arrived while gate was still occupied. | • Tower warns the crew before landing that their gate (‘seat’) is still occupied, reinforcing that the issue is gate availability arising from their early arrival.

Evidence_Details.message: Flight landed 35 min before its scheduled time (08:06 actual vs 08:41 scheduled)
Evidence_Details.relevance: Meets ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold, triggering possible gate-conflict scenario.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight at Gate F7 (SKW5740) pushed at 08:26, only 1 min after its 08:25 scheduled departure (not ≥15 min late).
Evidence_Details.relevance: Gate F7 was legitimately occupied until 08:26, so the arriving aircraft had no gate to park when it reached the ramp; no late-departure condition exists.

Evidence_Details.message: “Skywest 5313, continue down the east line, transition to the west line and hold behind company on the west line …”
Evidence_Details.relevance: Ramp instructs SKW5313 to hold in the alley, confirming it is waiting for a gate to open because it arrived while gate was still occupied.

Evidence_Details.message: “… 6313 … unfortunately your seat is occupied …”
Evidence_Details.relevance: Tower warns the crew before landing that their gate (‘seat’) is still occupied, reinforcing that the issue is gate availability arising from their early arrival.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms flight met the ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold | • Immediately after touchdown the crew is told its gate is still occupied – classic early-arrival gate conflict | • Shows the blocking aircraft was on time/early; delay was not caused by a late departure, confirming early-arrival is root cause | • Gate only became available 26 min after landing; controller explicitly advises when gate opens | • Confirms the lengthy taxi-in interval being classified

Evidence_Details.message: Landing Time 08:20 vs Scheduled 08:52  (-32 min schedule variance)
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms flight met the ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold

Evidence_Details.message: "United 336, looks like Echo 4 is occupied … hold short of runway 28R …"
Evidence_Details.relevance: Immediately after touchdown the crew is told its gate is still occupied – classic early-arrival gate conflict

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight UAL608 actually pushed at 08:42 (7 min BEFORE its 08:49 sched-dep → NOT late)
Evidence_Details.relevance: Shows the blocking aircraft was on time/early; delay was not caused by a late departure, confirming early-arrival is root cause

Evidence_Details.message: "United 336, we've got a new gate, Echo 7, it's open."
Evidence_Details.relevance: Gate only became available 26 min after landing; controller explicitly advises when gate opens

Evidence_Details.message: Gate in-time 08:58 – total taxi 38 min ( >30 )
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms the lengthy taxi-in interval being classified

flights.Key_Evidence: • Marks the start of taxi-in time calculation. | • Marks the end of taxi-in time. | • Confirms that taxi-in duration never exceeded the 30-minute threshold required to classify a delay, therefore no qualifying taxi-in delay actually occurred.

Evidence_Details.message: Landing time recorded: 08:23:18 PT
Evidence_Details.relevance: Marks the start of taxi-in time calculation.

Evidence_Details.message: Gate-in time recorded: 08:53:00 PT
Evidence_Details.relevance: Marks the end of taxi-in time.

Evidence_Details.message: Computed taxi-in time: 29.7 minutes ( < 30-minute delay threshold )
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms that taxi-in duration never exceeded the 30-minute threshold required to classify a delay, therefore no qualifying taxi-in delay actually occurred.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Controller immediately tells UAL2358 (mis-read as 2258) that no gate is available, indicating the assigned gate F11 is still occupied. | • Previous flight UAL713 finally begins push-back from gate F11 at 12:24—almost two hours after its 10:35 scheduled departure, confirming a >15-minute late departure. | • UAL2358 is instructed to hold on the taxiway shortly after landing, consistent with waiting for the gate to open. | • Quantifies the late departure component required for the compound classification. | • Meets the ≥15-minute early-arrival criterion for the compound label.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight UAL713 scheduled OUT 10:35; actual pushback observed 12:24 (>100-min delay).
Evidence_Details.relevance: Quantifies the late departure component required for the compound classification.

Evidence_Details.message: UAL2358 landed at 11:54, scheduled 12:20 (-26 min early).
Evidence_Details.relevance: Meets the ≥15-minute early-arrival criterion for the compound label.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms the flight’s touchdown time sequence for taxi-in delay analysis. | • Previous aircraft at gate F6 (SKW4802) pushed essentially on-schedule (12:54 actual vs 12:55 scheduled) showing no late-departure influence; gate blocked only because arriving flight was extremely late. | • Indicates SKW5460 was finally cleared to taxi to its gate after SKW4802 left, consistent with waiting for normal on-time departure rather than any operational irregularity.
